properties.areaDesc: Linn; Delaware; Johnson; Iowa; Buchanan; Benton
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 3 at 2:23PM CST until January 4 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Quad Cities IA IL
properties.description:
...Quick Round of Snow Late This Afternoon into Tonight...

.A fast moving clipper system will bring light to moderate snow to
parts of eastern Iowa from late this afternoon into tonight.
Narrow bands of heavier snow are expected to develop which could
drop visibilities to a quarter mile for a brief time and quickly
lead to slushy accumulation on pavement. The heavier bands of
snow will make for hazardous travel conditions and greatly
reduced visibilities. Total snow accumulations are expected to
range from 1 to 3 inches.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches
with isolated amounts near 3 inches possible. Brief moderate to
heavy bands of snow may drop visibilities down to a quarter
mile at times.

* WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Iowa.

* WHEN...Until 3 AM CST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and rapid changes in
visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening
commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Call 511 for road conditions.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CST SATURDAY
